main_definition: The action of making a place or arrangement suitable or comfortable for someone.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To provide with lodging and facilities at an affordable price
meanings_and_examples.example: The hotel offered great accommodation rates during the off-season.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A place to live, especially one that is not very desirable or attractive
meanings_and_examples.example: He found a cheap but run-down apartment as his first form of accommodation in the city.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of adjusting something or making changes so it will fit better or work more effectively
meanings_and_examples.example: She had to make some accommodations to her schedule to attend her daughter's soccer game.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A suitable place for a particular purpose, especially in terms of living arrangements
meanings_and_examples.example: Finding good accommodation was the first challenge they faced when moving to a new country.
